def isCallableRegistered()

def registerCallable()

def deregisterCallableByIndex()

def reset()

Description¶

Register callables to Maya message events. Registered callables are invoked when the corresponding message is processed.

Events¶

The following Event subclasses provide enumerations which map directly to a Maya message event for a specific OpenMaya.MMessage subclass:

  • SceneEvent ⟶ OpenMaya.MSceneMessage
  • DGEvent ⟶ OpenMaya.MDGMessage

The UserEvent enumerations provide custom Maya events:

  • Processing of these events is predicated upon user input (ie. the user is prompted to confirm or cancel an operation).
  • UserEvent enumerations such as UserEvent.ConfirmSave are provided as an alternative to SceneEvent enumerations when a student version of Maya is being used.
  • Student versions of Maya prompt the user for input, however the events corresponding to the SceneEvent enumerations are processed regardless of whether the user cancels the operation.

Registration¶

Callbacks for each event are installed as needed (ie. upon registering the initial callable for a specific event). Callbacks for each event are removed when there are no longer any callables registered to an event.

A callable can only be registered once per event, whereby the conditions for registration are are predicated upon object equivalence. A special case is made for functools.partial objects which must pass an additional test. Each functools.partial object must have unique func, args and keywords member values.

The interface for this module is designed to be simple. Therefore callback initializers which take additional parameters will be passed default values. See OpenMaya.MDGMessage.addNodeAddedCallback() as an example.

Warning

Reloading this module will result in any registered callbacks being removed and any registered callables being cleared. Data is registered by Enum type, meaning registry keys (ie. class ids) will be invalidated upon reloading.

class msTools.tools.callback_manager.Event¶

Bases: msTools.vendor.enum.Enum

Baseclass used to construct Maya event enumerations.

Note

Class is designed to be inherited.

class msTools.tools.callback_manager.UserEvent¶

Bases: msTools.tools.callback_manager.Event

Derived Event enumerations designed for student versions of Maya. Events correspond to Maya messages which produce a dialog prompt.

Registered callables are executed for the corresponding After... SceneEvent.

Note

There is no CreateReference event as cancelling still creates a reference, therefore you may as well use the SceneEvent.

class msTools.tools.callback_manager.DGEvent¶

Bases: msTools.tools.callback_manager.Event

Derived Event enumerations corresponding to OpenMaya.MDGMessage events.

Note

This tool is designed to provide a generic interface for registering callbacks, therefore some functionality is removed from the user.

  • For example, the events DGEvent.NodeAdded and DGEvent.NodeRemoved correspond to messages for OpenMaya.MDGMessage.addNodeAddedCallback() and OpenMaya.MDGMessage.addNodeRemovedCallback().
  • Callbacks for these events will be registered with nodeType='dependNode'.
TimeChange = <DGEvent.TimeChange: 1>¶
ForceUpdate = <DGEvent.ForceUpdate: 2>¶
NodeAdded = <DGEvent.NodeAdded: 3>¶
NodeRemoved = <DGEvent.NodeRemoved: 4>¶
ConnectionChange = <DGEvent.ConnectionChange: 5>¶
PreConnectionChange = <DGEvent.PreConnectionChange: 6>¶
msTools.tools.callback_manager.isCallableRegistered(event, callable_)¶

Verify a callable object is registered to a derived Event enumeration.

Parameters:
  • event (T <= Event) – An enumeration of type T with upper bound Event. Corresponds to a Maya message event.
  • callable_ (callable[.., any]) – A callable object. Can be a functools.partial object.
Returns:

bool – True if the callable is registered to the event, False otherwise.
msTools.tools.callback_manager.registerCallable(event, callable_, receivesCallbackArgs=False)¶

Register a callable object to a derived Event enumeration corresponding to a Maya message event.

If this is the first callable to be registered for the Event enumeration, a callback associated with that event will be installed.

Note

If the callable is a functools.partial object and receivesCallbackArgs=True, it is the caller’s responsibility to ensure:

  1. The functools.partial.func callable can receive the args and keywords.
  2. The functools.partial.func callable can receive the callback arguments.
Parameters:
  • event (T <= Event) – An enumeration of type T with upper bound Event. Corresponds to a Maya message event.
  • callable_ (callable[.., any]) – A callable object. Can be a functools.partial object.
  • receivesCallbackArgs (bool, optional) – Whether the callable will receive any callback arguments if they exist. Defaults to False. For example, a callable registered to the DGEvent.NodeAdded event can receive the node OpenMaya.MObject passed to the callback corresponding to OpenMaya.MDGMessage.addNodeAddedCallback().
msTools.tools.callback_manager.deregisterCallable(event, callable_)¶

Deregisters a callable object from a derived Event enumeration corresponding to a Maya message event.

If this was the only callable registered to the derived Event enumeration, the callback associated with that event will be removed.

Parameters:
  • event (T <= Event) – An enumeration of type T with upper bound Event. Corresponds to a Maya message event.
  • callable_ (callable[.., any]) – A callable object. Can be a functools.partial object.
msTools.tools.callback_manager.deregisterCallableByIndex(event, index)¶

Deregisters a callable object from a Maya event based on its indexed position in the internal registry.

This may be useful if all references to the callable were lost.

If this was the only callable registered to the derived Event enumeration, the callback associated with that event will be removed.

Parameters:
  • event (T <= Event) – An enumeration of type T with upper bound Event. Corresponds to a Maya message event.
  • index (int) – The index of the callable to remove. Corresponds to the order the callable was registered.
msTools.tools.callback_manager.reset()¶

Removes any registered callbacks and clears any registered callables.
